articles.author: Henrique Doro
articles.description:
Skip to the bottom if you want the conclusion of this project üò¨
This may be a bit over-the-top, but to start my entry at World's Largest Hackathon by Bolt I'll actually build another entry to help me document my journey.
I've long been a fan of devlogs, videos or essays showing the work on a game, piece of art or software. The issue is I'm always a bit lazy to edit videos of my dev journey, so I never got around to creating them.
Instead, an idea has been circulating my mind for a while: what if dev logs were partially automated? I won't answer this question fully for now, but I'll take a stab at it with a first submission to the hackathon.
As I'm building with Bolt, I've started with a prompt:

Before putting it into Bolt, though, I want to refine the prompt. I want to see if I can make ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Starting Bolt's hackathon by kicking Bolt.new's tires - TL;DR vibe-coding is ü§Æ

articles.author: Sakshi Verma
articles.description:
CppCon 2024 was my first in-person conference ‚Äî and it ended up being one of the most meaningful experiences in my career so far.
I didn‚Äôt just attend: I volunteered behind the scenes, gave a lightning talk, and connected with some amazing people in the C++ community. If you‚Äôve ever considered attending CppCon, or want to do more than just sit in the audience, this post is for you.
CppCon isn‚Äôt just for language experts. It‚Äôs a welcoming space for learners, contributors, and quiet observers too. Here‚Äôs what made it special for me:
üåü Volunteering gave me a peek behind the curtain and introduced me to people I wouldn‚Äôt have met otherwise.
üé§ Giving a lightning talk helped me push past hesitation and find my voice in front of a supportive crowd.
ü§ù Networking events like the Women‚Äôs Lunch and Community Dinner offered real connections, not just business cards.
Submit something even if you‚Äôre unsure. A 5-minute talk can open doors and build confidence.
Say yes to volunteering. You learn, help others, and become part of the community fast.
Plan your schedule but allow for serendipity. Some of the best moments happen between sessions.
Join the Discord. Many friendships and insights start there before the conference even begins.
If you're curious about what the week looked like in detail ‚Äî including anecdotes, reflections, and key sessions ‚Äî check out my full trip report here:
üëâ CppCon 2024: My Journey as a Speaker, Volunteer, and First-Time Attendee
Thanks for reading! If you're planning to attend this year and have questions, feel free to reach out. I‚Äôm happy to share what helped me feel less overwhelmed and more involved.
¬© 2024 Sakshi Verma. Originally published on Medium. This version is adapted for the Dev.to community.
articles.title: Why This Year‚Äôs CppCon Might Be Your Best Career Move Yet

articles.author: Mahmudul Haque Shawon
articles.description:
Hey everyone! üëã
Me and my friends ‚Äî Abir, Siam, Rajib, Omair, and I (Mahmudul Haque Shawon) ‚Äî are cooking up something exciting called Learner‚Äôs Pointer. It‚Äôs a platform designed specifically for Diploma in Engineering students to get better learning resources and connect with teachers and mentors.
Right now, I‚Äôm handling the backend with Django, building some cool features like:
Device-based login restriction ‚Äî so a student can only be logged in on one device at a time. This helps keep things fair and prevents account sharing.
If someone logs in from another device, the previous session gets logged out automatically.
Secure password resets and soon, two-factor authentication!
Meanwhile, my buddy Abir is crafting the frontend using HTML and Tailwind CSS, making sure everything looks slick and works smoothly.
Our other friends ‚Äî Siam, Rajib, and Omair ‚Äî are helping with content, testing, and planning new features.
Our goal? To build a safe, easy-to-use space where diploma students can learn, share, and grow without distractions.
Stay tuned! More updates coming soon üöÄ
articles.title: Building Learner‚Äôs Pointer: A Smart Learning Platform for Diploma Students

articles.author: Maurizio Morri
articles.description:
Artificial intelligence has long been promoted as the next frontier in drug discovery. It promised faster timelines, lower costs, and more precise targeting of disease. But recent updates from the field suggest that the reality is more complicated. Despite the billions invested, the AI drug discovery revolution is hitting the brakes, at least for now.
A new article published in Drug Target Review outlines a set of major challenges. AI models struggle to interpret complex biological systems, and there is still no standard process for validating or approving AI-generated drug candidates. The piece highlights that although AI can speed up discovery, it often underperforms when it comes to robustness, data integration, and real clinical translation.
You can read the full article here:
https://www.drugtargetreview.com/article/157270/navigating-the-ai-revolution-a-roadmap-for-pharmas-future/
Another recent paper published in Science takes a similarly measured tone. While it acknowledges the potential of AI in areas like molecular generation and structure prediction, it also points out that most applications remain in early stages. The authors argue that AI should support traditional workflows, not replace them, until more solid evidence of its impact emerges.
Read the Science article here:
https://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/science.adx0339
These are not failures. They are reminders that scientific progress moves step by step. AI will likely become essential to future drug pipelines, but the timeline may be longer and more incremental than early hype suggested.
articles.title: Is AI Falling Short in the Race for New Medicines?

articles.author: Kaemon Lovendahl
articles.description:
Need to react the instant a file lands in a bucket without babysitting a server? AWS Lambda + Amazon S3 is your peanut-butter-and-jelly combo. This how-to walks you through wiring the two together with Python, sprinkling in battle-tested tips (and a dash of Glitched-Goblet snark) along the way. I recently used this setup to automate a data pipeline, and it‚Äôs been a game-changer. So I thought I‚Äôd share the recipe.



What
Why




An AWS account with Admin or equivalent rights
You‚Äôll create buckets, roles, and functions.


AWS CLI + configured credentials
Faster than clicking in the console.


Python 3.11+ locally (optional)
Handy for zipper-up deployments or unit tests.


A splash of IAM know-how
Least-privilege saves future-you from 3 a.m. alerts.






Piece
Role




Handler (lambda_handl‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to build a Lambda function that is triggered by S3

articles.author: SEENUVASAN P
articles.description:
Hi everyone! Today, I want to share a fun mini-project I built: a simple Rock Paper Scissors game using just HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. It‚Äôs a great project for beginners to practice JavaScript logic and DOM manipulation. Let me walk you through how it works! The game lets the user choose between Rock, Paper, or Scissors. The computer then randomly picks one of the three options. The result is displayed along with the running score for both the user and the computer. The HTML defines a simple layout with a title, three buttons, and two sections to display results and score.

Rock Paper Scissors
articles.title: Day 6: Building a Rock Paper Scissors Game with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

articles.description:

I'm excited to share that I've started working on a new personal project: a professional-grade digital restaurant menu system, designed as if it were being developed in a real-world company environment.

Use this as a centerpiece for my developer portfolio to apply for international opportunities
Backend: Kotlin + Spring Boot

Global error handling

‚úÖ Defined the system's Entity-Relationship model

I'll be sharing more updates soon ‚Äî including challenges, architecture decisions and how I‚Äôm applying clean code principles along the way.
If you're interested in mobile systems, restaurant tech, or just want to connect, feel free to reach out or follow the journey! üöÄ


  
  
  kotlin #springboot #reactnative #typescript #postgresql #softwaredevelopment #portfolio

articles.author: liu yang
articles.description:
Offline Development Environment Setup for DevEco Studio



  
  
  Installing Hypium in an Offline Environment




Prepare Files on an Online Computer
Create a folder (e.g., third_library).
Create an oh-package.json5 file with the following content:


   {
     "dependencies": {
       "@ohos/hypium": "1.0.18"
     }
   }

 - Open the command line and run `ohpm install`. This will generate an `oh_modules` folder and an `oh-package-lock.json5` file.
 - Ensure environment variables are set before running `ohpm install`.

Transfer Files to Offline Computer
Copy the oh_modules folder and oh-package-lock.json5 file to the root directory of your project on the offline computer.
Note
Ensure the ohpm version on both online and offline computers is the same; otherwise, the oh-package-lock.json5 fil‚Ä¶

articles.author: liu yang
articles.description:
DevEco Studio Network Configuration Guide


DevEco Studio relies on a network connection for proper functionality.
Personal/Home Networks: Typically, no proxy configuration is needed.
Enterprise Networks: Proxy settings may be required due to network restrictions.
On the welcome page, click Diagnose.
If in a project, go to Help > Diagnostic Tools > Diagnose Development Environment.

Access Proxy Settings:


From the welcome page: Customize > All Settings‚Ä¶ > Appearance & Behavior > System Settings > HTTP Proxy.
If in a project: File > Settings > Appearance & Behavior > System Settings > HTTP Proxy (or DevEco Studio > Preferences for macOS).
HTTP Proxy Configuration:



Host Name: Proxy server's hostname or IP.
Port Number: Proxy server's port.
No Proxy For: URLs/IPs to bypass the proxy (separate with commas).
Proxy Authentication (if required):



Login: Username for proxy access.
Password: Password for proxy access.
Remember: Check to save credentials.

After configuration, click Check Connection and enter a URL (e.g., https://developer.huawei.com). A "Connection successful" message confirms the proxy is correctly set up.
articles.title: Configure the agent

articles.author: CloudDefense.AI
articles.description:
NIST 800-218 is more than just a compliance document. It provides a detailed roadmap for incorporating security into every phase of the software development lifecycle. Instead of treating cybersecurity as a last-minute concern, the framework encourages organizations to embed protective measures from the outset, continuing through coding, testing, release, and beyond.
The framework focuses on developing a culture of secure coding, automated vulnerability detection, and process-driven risk mitigation‚Äîhelping teams shift from reactive fixes to preventive strategies.
To streamline adoption, the SSDF is divided into four distinct areas of focus:
Preparation involves aligning teams around shared security goals, ensuring leadership commitment, training developers, and deploying automation tools s‚Ä¶
articles.title: What Is the Role of NIST 800-218 in Modern Software Development?
